metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28736 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: There's a use-after-free vulnerability in grub_cmd_chainloader() function; The chainloader command is used to boot up operating systems that doesn't support multiboot and do not have direct support from GRUB2. When executing chainloader more than once a use-after-free vulnerability is triggered. If an attacker can control the GRUB2's memory allocation pattern sensitive data may be exposed and arbitrary code execution can be achieved.

criterions.comment: grub2 package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
grub2-signed package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
